I want to particularly thank my colleagues @RepJerryNadler, @RepJeffries, and @davidcicilline for their leadership in our work #ForThePeople to reduce the cost of health care and prescription drugs. This is so important for so many Americans.

Millions of Americans skip medicine doses because they can't afford enough. Meanwhile, drug companies are making record-breaking profits.

@HouseJudiciary is working to expand access to cheaper generic medicines, saving Americans billions of dollars. #ForThePeople #ProtectOurCare

.@HouseDemocrats are working on new legislation #ForThePeople to hold prescription drug companies accountable and stop them from unfairly raising drug prices.

It's absolutely wrong for these highly-profitable companies to increase their profits at the cost of sick Americans.

The average American spends $1,200 per year on prescription drugs -- more than in any other country.

Here's a simple idea: make it easier to get generic drugs, which are up to 80% less expensive.

Today @HouseJudiciary is going to advance legislation to do just that.

HAPPENING NOW: @HouseJudiciary is marking up NEW legislation to lower prescription drug costs. @HouseDemocrats are laser-focused on reducing health care costs and making sure every American can access affordable health care. #ProtectOurCare https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6QEg1WER_68 …

The existing policy separated children from their parents, inflicted psychological trauma, put people in cages, and made a mockery of the legal rights of those seeking asylum. How much "tougher" can you get? I'll do everything possible to stop that from happening.

While several men have left the administration, the president choose to single out Secretary Nielsen as not “tough" enough. I believe Secretary Nielsen had enough of trying to appease a President who just doesn’t get American principles or values.

Secretary Nielsen’s departure won’t end the president's cruel family separation policy, nor reunite children with their parents. That policy comes from the top. The President has given an unjust, ill-informed and improper order to the Secretary and CBP.
Thanks to Cypress High School for the invitation to the Youth Empowerment, Leadership, and Learning (YELL) Conference. Courage, preparation, opportunity.

I am depending on the next generation of leaders. Remember to believe in yourself, know your power, work hard, play by the rules, make sacrifices, be brave. If you get knocked down, get back in the game. Prepare yourself for opportunities, and have the courage to take them. pic.twitter.com/M8o55YPXis

You can hear Dr. King's words yourself here. Take the time. It's worth it.  http://okra.stanford.edu/media/audio/680403001.mp3 …

"I don't know what will happen," said King. "We've got some difficult days ahead. But it really doesn't matter with me now, because I've been to the mountaintop."

"I may not get there with you. But I want you to know tonight, that we, as a people, will get to the promised land."

Dr. King told us this: "Let us rise up tonight with a greater readiness. Let us stand with a greater determination. And let us move on in these powerful days, these days of challenge, to make America what it ought to be. We have an opportunity to make America a better nation."

Dr. King was shot and killed 51 years ago today. He was in Memphis, working for the right of sanitation workers to be treated with dignity. The night before, he gave his last speech.

"The issue is injustice," he said. "We need all of you."

We still do. #MLK51 pic.twitter.com/3KAJcssv2d
